title: User Authentication via Social Login
description: Verify users can authenticate successfully using integrated social login providers and create user profiles.

steps.description: Navigate to login page
Click on available social login button (e.g., Google, Facebook)
Complete social login flow and consent if prompted
Verify redirection to user profile creation page if profile does not exist
Complete user profile form and submit
Verify profile is created and user is redirected to home/dashboard relevant to tenant
Logout and repeat with different social login providers
Verify all supported social logins authenticate seamlessly

title: Event Creation and Configuration Workflow
description: Ensure event organizers can create, configure, save, and publish events with all required settings.

steps.description: Login as event organizer with admin dashboard access
Navigate to Event Management section and click 'Create New Event'
Fill in all mandatory fields: event name, description, location, date/time
Configure event settings: ticket types, prices, registration open/close dates
Upload event media such as images or flyers
Save draft and verify no errors are shown
Publish the event
Verify event is listed in admin dashboard and visible under tenant’s event listings
Attempt to create event with invalid or missing required fields
Verify appropriate validation error messages are displayed

title: Event Registration and Stripe Payment Processing
description: Test user registration flow including ticket selection, payment through Stripe, and status updates.

steps.description: Authenticate as a user
Navigate to a published event registration page
Select ticket type and quantity
Fill in required registration form fields including guest management if applicable
Proceed to payment
Complete credit card payment using Stripe test card credentials
Verify payment is successful and confirmation page is shown
Check database/registration status is set to confirmed
Verify QR code ticket is generated and displayed for download or email
Attempt registration with payment failure or cancellation
Verify system displays appropriate payment failure feedback and registration is not confirmed

title: QR Code Generation and Attendee Check-in
description: Test QR code generation post-registration and validate QR code scanning and check-in workflow.

steps.description: Complete successful event registration to receive QR code ticket
Verify QR code is unique, valid, and scannable on attendee’s device or printed ticket
Use admin dashboard or dedicated check-in app to scan attendee QR code
Confirm attendee check-in is recorded in system and status updated in real-time
Attempt to scan the same QR code again
Verify system prevents duplicate check-in and displays appropriate error/warning
Attempt scanning an invalid or malformed QR code
Verify system handles error gracefully without crashes

title: Multi-Tenant Data Isolation Verification
description: Verify that data from one tenant is completely isolated and inaccessible by users from other tenants.

steps.description: Login as a user from Tenant A and navigate to event listings and registrations
Verify only Tenant A’s events and related data are visible
Login as a user from Tenant B and attempt to access or guess Tenant A’s event URLs and data endpoints
Verify access is denied with appropriate authorization error
Try to submit a form or API request with tenant ID from another tenant
Verify that data injection or leakage does not occur and request is blocked

title: Admin Dashboard Event Analytics and Reporting
description: Confirm admin dashboard loads event analytics and reports accurately and updates in real-time.

steps.description: Login as admin user
Navigate to event analytics dashboard
Verify summary metrics for registrations, payments, and attendance are displayed correctly
Generate event report for a selected date range
Verify report data matches underlying registration and payment records
Trigger new registration and verify real-time dashboard update
Confirm that analytics and UI refresh to reflect new data without errors

title: Search and Filtering of Events and Registrants
description: Verify advanced search and filtering functionality returns accurate results quickly for events and attendee lists.

steps.description: Navigate to event listings or registrations management page
Enter search terms such as event name, dates, or registrant details
Verify filtered results match search criteria
Apply multiple filters simultaneously (e.g., event date range and ticket type)
Verify that combined filters narrow down results accordingly
Attempt to search with special characters and SQL injection patterns
Verify system handles input safely and does not crash or expose data

title: Email Notification System for Event Communications
description: Test automated email notifications triggered by event registration, payment confirmation, and admin messages.

steps.description: Register for an event and complete payment
Verify payment confirmation email with QR code ticket is sent to registrant
Admin sends a bulk email notification to event attendees
Verify all recipients receive the email with correct content and formatting
Trigger email with invalid recipient address
Verify system handles bounce or error without failure

title: Media Upload and Management
description: Verify file uploads for event media succeed and media assets are properly linked and accessible within events.

steps.description: Login to admin dashboard and navigate to media management page
Upload various media types (images, documents) with allowed file size and format
Verify upload success message and media visible in list
Assign uploaded media to an event and save
Verify media appears correctly in event details or public event page
Attempt upload of unsupported file types or oversized files
Verify validation errors are shown and upload is rejected

title: UI Accessibility and Responsiveness
description: Ensure that all user-facing pages and admin interfaces load without critical UI errors and are accessible on different devices.

steps.description: Navigate to various pages: login, event list, event registration, admin dashboard
Verify no critical UI or layout errors on desktop browsers
Resize browser and test responsiveness on tablet and mobile screen sizes
Verify UI components adjust correctly and remain usable on all tested screen sizes
Use keyboard navigation to interact with critical UI elements such as forms and buttons
Verify focus states, tab order, and ARIA labels are correct for accessibility
